item.title: Teens sentenced over deadly Wollongong street brawl fuelled by social media group chat
item.description: A social media feud between teenage girls in Wollongong in 2023 erupted into a deadly street fight, leaving Kristie McBride dead and several teens now sentenced for her manslaughter.

item.title: Search suspended for deep-sea diver Timothy Bennett in Coral Sea
item.description: A professional deep-sea diver, with several fish species named in his honour, is remembered as a loving father and well-respected in the science community for his contributions to the study of fish species.

item.title: ABC News - Trusted Source of Latest News & Headlines
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Smashed windscreen in remote SA unlikely caused by meteorite, museum says
item.description: Scientists were hoping an object that smashed the windscreen of a self-driving car in October was a meteorite, but SA Museum's investigation says it remains a mystery.

item.title: Famine ends in Gaza, Integrated Food Security Phase Classification report says
item.description: A report by the Integrated Food Security Phase Classification is still warning that over 100,000 children face malnutrition over the coming months.

item.title: Anthony Albanese faces primary test of his prime ministership in Bondi response
item.description: While the prime minister will forever struggle to shed the perception that he was too slow to recognise the threat to Australia's Jewish community, he is taking action.

item.title: US to miss deadline to release all Epstein files, Trump official admits
item.description: Deputy Attorney-General Todd Blanche says several hundred thousand Epstein-related documents should be released by the legal deadline, but several hundred thousand more could be a "couple of weeks" away.

item.title: Today in history: Picasso painting worth millions stolen in daring art heist
item.description: The 2007 Brazilian heist was not the last time a nimble thief made off with a Picasso. And as many Melburnians know, it certainly wasn't the first.

item.title: Jewish man Gaby Silver never felt unsafe in Australia, then October 7 and Bondi happened
item.description: The rise in antisemitism in Australia since October 7 has reshaped the way Gaby Silver's family lives. After the Bondi attack, they're even more on edge.

item.title: The teacher, driver and host who helped strangers take refuge during the Bondi terror attack
item.description: These are the stories of everyday people who stepped up during dark times, and of a community coming together when two gunmen sought to tear them apart on December 14.

item.title: How the Bondi shooters got access to now-banned guns
item.description: With Australia's strict gun laws, how was Sajid Akram able to legally own the gun he was using to slaughter innocent people in Bondi on December 14?

item.title: BOM Christmas weather forecast shows cool day in the east, searing heat in the west
item.description: Australia is experiencing a smorgasbord of wild weather in the lead-up to Christmas, featuring extreme heat, humidity, severe thunderstorms, and tropical storms all on the cards.

item.title: Coronial inquest into deaths of cultural leaders Big Brother and Little Brother recommends spit hood ban
item.description: The NT coroner makes nine recommendations following an inquest into the deaths of two disabled Aboriginal brothers who spent a number of years homeless in Alice Springs.

item.title: Environmental experts, detection dogs team up to protect native freshwater turtles
item.description: A team of environmental experts, Indigenous rangers and conservation detection dogs is working on recovering the population of native freshwater turtles.

item.title: Oxford evolutionary researcher says humans may have been kissing Neanderthals
item.description: Why is swapping saliva something all human societies have normalised? Turns out kissing isn't just a human thing — all sorts of species appear to kiss, and new research suggests Neanderthals did it too.

item.title: Melbourne University Women's Football Club was once a powerhouse. Now it's at risk of folding
item.description: Melbourne University is the latest women’s Aussie Rules club fighting for survival, but it is hoping intervention from an AFL executive can turn the club’s fortunes around.

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein documents partially published by US Department of Justice — as it happened
item.description: A trove of documents about the investigation into sex offender Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirator, Ghislaine Maxwell, has been published. Look back at how we analysed the files and the fallout.

item.title: Murgon residents 'at breaking point' during end-of-year crime spike
item.description: The crime rate spikes every year around the holidays, according to the police. Tensions are rising in the Murgon community, as residents say they don't feel safe in their homes.

item.title: Queensland family saves thousands of dollars after embracing the spirit of 'Thriftmas' over holiday period
item.description: Rising expenses across the festive season have driven a family of five in Brisbane to set a rule to only purchase Christmas presents from second-hand stores — and they've been pleasantly surprised by the treasures they've uncovered.

item.title: Former patients 'left waiting for justice' after damning report into Brisbane's Wolston Park Mental Hospital
item.description: Brisbane's Wolston Park Mental Hospital closed in 2001, but a 12-month review has shed light on its history of sexual abuse and patient mistreatment.

item.title: How are Australian parents responding to the social media ban for under-16s?
item.description: For some parents, the social media bans for under-16s have come as a relief. But others say they are fuelling conflict.

item.title: Epstein files partially released by US Department of Justice
item.description: The Trump administration publishes the first tranche of the Epstein files, but the release of hundreds of thousands of documents looks to have been delayed.

item.title: Health and safety case against Tasmania's Adams gin distillery dismissed in court
item.description: A work health and safety case against a distillery in Perth, northern Tasmania, is dismissed.

item.title: Mourners and support services gather in Bondi as Anthony Albanese calls for unity — as it happened
item.description: Hundreds of surf lifesavers have gathered on Bondi Beach to pay tribute to the victims of last Sunday's terrorist attack. Follow live.

item.title: WA researchers find 'alarming number' of children with strep A
item.description: An infectious disease study hopes to see faster and earlier diagnosis of strep A to prevent chronic diseases in high-risk communities.

item.title: Islamic State made headlines after being linked to the Bondi attack. Here's why
item.description: What is this group, which once ruled a territorial "caliphate" and inspired attacks all over the world?

item.title: Grace Lillian Lee weaves a path from the Torres Strait to Paris
item.description: Lee's woven, wearable art creations have catapulted her from Cairns and the Torres Strait to Paris, a bustling textile mecca more than 15,000 kilometres away.

item.title: US strikes dozens of Islamic State targets in Syria, officials say
item.description: Described as "a declaration of vengeance" by US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth, the strikes come after Donald Trump vowed retaliation for an attack on US personnel.

item.title: How a Queensland family is pushing for change after a devastating loss
item.description: Tyler Pask devoted his life to being an incredible father, selfless brother and a diligent emergency service worker for the Queensland Fire Department. Now his family is transforming their grief into encouraging other young men to access support for their mental health.

item.title: Tasmanian government faces questions over Pulse advertising spend after it asked for an election
item.description: The Tasmanian premier's department authorised more than $13,000 of taxpayer money to be spent with a local media organisation to promote the budget after the government asked for an election to be held, documents show.

item.title: Ambitious plan to share Carnarvon's food bowl both locally and statewide faces hurdles
item.description: Carnarvon's fresh produce could help Western Australia's food insecurity crisis, but there is concern not enough is being done to address the issue locally first.

item.title: NT housing market continues to grow as house prices climb across cities
item.description: First home buyers are being priced out of the Darwin property market by interstate investors looking to cash in on high rental yields, with many properties sold without even being listed.

item.title: Kalgoorlie the glittering prize for Frenchman Bruno Vincent
item.description: Bruno Vincent has spent his life searching for gold, so there was only one Australian city on his travel bucket list.

item.title: Why new Perth Glory coach Adam Griffiths might be Australian football's most interesting character
item.description: In a team struggling to retain fans, in a league battling for attention, newly appointed Perth Glory coach Adam Griffiths may just be the man with the answers for both problems.

item.title: Rare pink platypus spotted in East Gippsland river by Melbourne fisherman
item.description: In a remote river in Victoria's east, a fisherman says he has encountered an ultra-rare pink platypus, one of only a handful ever sighted in the past 200 years.

item.title: Rare pink platypus spotted in East Gippsland river
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Jake Paul knocked out by Anthony Joshua in sloppy Netflix boxing match in Miami
item.description: Jake Paul is chastened by the referee and knocked out by his opponent in their made-for-Netflix bout in Miami.

item.title: NSW Premier Chris Minns backs calls for royal commission into Bondi Beach terror attack
item.description: New South Wales Premier Chris Minns is supporting calls for a royal commission to be held into the Bondi Beach terror attack, which claimed the lives of 15 innocent people.

item.title: England slammed for sending assistant coaches to front media after 'nonsense' Ashes interview
item.description: Australian Test cricket great Jason Gillespie slams England after a "contradictory" interview from an assistant coach following day three in Adelaide.

item.title: A first look through the Epstein files reveals celebrity snaps, police notes and a lot of Bill Clinton
item.description: The US Department of Justice today released thousands of files it holds on late sex offender and disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein. Here's what's been uncovered in just a few hours.

item.title: In pictures: Surf lifesavers pay tribute to Bondi victims
item.description: Hundreds of surf lifesavers and lifeguards, many of whom responded to the Bondi terror attack, form a human chain in a moving tribute to the 15 people killed.

item.title: Vanuatu continues to rebuild one year after devastating earthquake
item.description: Tourists are returning to Vanuatu a year on from a major catastrophe. But many demolished buildings are yet to be rebuilt and some locals are frustrated with the pace of repairs.

item.title: Easy last-minute baked gifts
item.description: From super-quick shortbread to giant chocolatey cookies, your guests will be delighted to take home something they will actually use.

item.title: Focus on Bill Clinton in Epstein Files raises questions about how curated the documents were
item.description: The thousands of photos paint a picture of a life spent with the rich and famous but little that is incriminating to anyone but Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Men left 'shaken' and 'overwhelmed' after arrest in Liverpool intend to sue NSW Police
item.description: The group were detained on Thursday after tactical police rammed a car in Liverpool in what was characterised as a precautionary measure following the Bondi terror attack.

item.title: Valentino Guseli wins snowboard halfpipe bronze at Copper Mountain World Cup
item.description: Valentino Guseli returns to half-pipe competition after 21 months to claim his 10th FIS World Cup podium and receive a huge confidence boost ahead of the Winter Olympic Games.

item.title: Marnus Labuschagne takes miracle catch and Nathan Lyon breaks England's resistance — quick hits from day four of third Ashes Test
item.description: Australia finishes day four needing four wickets to reclaim the Ashes thanks to Marnus Labuschagne and Nathan Lyon. Here are the quick hits from day four of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

item.title: England abandons Bazball but is still no match for Australia with Ashes triumph imminent
item.description: England's belated abandonment of Bazball gives it temporary life, but reveals a painful truth — no version of this team is a match for the soon-to-be victorious Australians.

item.title: Former Pakistani PM Imran Khan and wife Bushra Bibi given 17-year jail sentence in new graft case
item.description: The case against Imran Khan and his wife Bushra Bibi centres on the alleged misuse of luxury state gifts from Saudi Arabia.

item.title: As Sydney's Jewish community reels from the Bondi attack, the path forward is unclear
item.description: As Sydney marks one week since the antisemitic Bondi attack, the Jewish community is grappling with the question of where to go from here.

item.title: With heads bowed after the Bondi terror attack, now is the time to listen to the Jewish community
item.description: If we are to inch towards unity, the more we pause to listen, the more sure-footed our path forward will be.

item.title: How Psy's billion-views trailblazer Gangnam Style presaged K-pop dominance
item.description: Who'd have guessed a South Korean man doing a goofy horse dance was a recipe for a global phenomenon? Thirteen years after it made YouTube history we revisit the legacy of Psy's Gangnam Style.

item.title: Christmas movies quiz: How well do you know festive films?
item.description: From Home Alone to Nightmare Before Christmas, how well do you know these Christmas classics?

item.title: Bondi mass shooting shows how extreme danger can spark bravery from bystanders
item.description: Experts advise to "escape, hide, and tell" in a terrorist attack. These men and women did otherwise and saved lives when gunmen opened fire at Bondi Beach.

item.title: Spain uses an algorithm to rank how safe women are. Sometimes it's wrong
item.description: In Spain, police have developed technology to work out how at-risk women might be from domestic violence. Some people have grave concerns about how often the algorithm is wrong.

item.title: Who's named in the Jeffrey Epstein files and who else was he connected to?
item.description: The Epstein files offer another glimpse into the financier's vast network of wealthy and influential figures. Here's what we know about his relationships with some of the world's most powerful people.

item.title: In a 'conservative' sport, this Richmond lawn bowls club has become a haven for LGBTQI+ inclusion
item.description: Three years ago, Richmond became the first lawn bowls club in the world to hold a Pride Cup. Since then, it has attracted a community of queer people who were otherwise lost to sport.

item.title: How 3D movie animation technology is helping injured athletes
item.description: The reasons for high rates of serious knee injuries among female athletes are not fully understood.

item.title: White and grey kangaroos to be sold to prevent overcrowding at Bordertown Wildlife Park
item.description: White western grey kangaroos are a popular sight in a small wildlife park nestled near the South Australia – Victoria border and some are now being sold.

item.title: The Hidden Line: Art of the Boyd Women uncovers the stories of the women in Arthur Boyd's family
item.description: A new exhibition highlights the women behind acclaimed Australian mid-century artist Arthur Boyd, bringing their overlooked stories and art practices to the fore.

item.title: The fight to save Australia's beaches from coastal erosion
item.description: Most Australians live by the beach, but the coastline we have built our lives around is disappearing before our eyes.

item.title: Australia's Bree Walker seals back-to-back World Cup wins ahead of the Winter Olympics
item.description: Australia's Bree Walker claims back-to-back World Cup wins to firm as the monobob favourite heading into the Winter Olympics.

item.title: Temporary recreational fishing restrictions eased amid SA's algal bloom
item.description: Some recreational fishing restrictions initially put in place to protect fish stocks impacted by South Australia's algal bloom have now been eased.

item.title: Automatic tipping becomes prominent due to rising cost of doing business in Australia
item.description: Australia's tipping culture is in the spotlight, following reports more businesses are adding automatic tips to diners' bills in response to rising operating costs.

item.title: Limited options for people trying to donate blood in regional NSW in wake of Bondi terror attack
item.description: Residents in parts of regional NSW could be left waiting months to give blood, with limited donation options available.

item.title: Jake Paul confirms he has a double broken jaw after controversial Anthony Joshua fight
item.description: Jake Paul calls out Canelo Alvarez as the American recovers from a double broken jaw from his controversial fight with Anthony Joshua.

item.title: Survivors search the Jeffrey Epstein files but find no sign of their evidence
item.description: Despite giving an FBI interview and victim statement, Epstein survivor Jess Michaels finds no trace of her evidence in the vast trove published online.

item.title: 'Dead zones' prompt tour operator Pennicott to fund marine study of D'Entrecasteaux Channel
item.description: For more than two decades, Rob Pennicott has taken tourists to see the D'Entrecasteaux Channel. But what he describes as "dead zones" have him so worried that he is funding a study to find what is going wrong.

item.title: Bondi Beach shooting: Thousands at Bondi mark a week since terror attack; Albanese booed by angry crowd — as it happened
item.description: Thousands of people heard messages of defiance and resilience, along with calls for “light, love and unity”, as they gathered at Bondi Beach to mark one week since the devastating terrorist attack. Look back on how events unfolded.

item.title: Victorian stock agent retires Toyota LandCruiser after 1 million kilometres
item.description: A Victorian stock agent's four-wheel drive LandCruiser has reached a rare milestone, as experts say Australians are keeping their cars longer than ever.

item.title: Ashes 2025: England batter Zak Crawley says Australia 'were the favourites' in defence of series disaster
item.description: England batter Zak Crawley says there's still plenty to play for despite Australia being on the verge of a 3-0 series lead.

item.title: Images removed from Epstein files less than a day after being posted
item.description: At least 16 Jeffrey Epstein-related files, including a photo of US President Donald Trump, disappear from a US Department of Justice webpage within a day of being posted, with no explanation.

item.title: Pilbara mining towns left out of government's battery rebate schemes
item.description: Residents in small Pilbara towns with power grids run by mining companies are excluded from home battery rebate schemes.

item.title: Vanuatu nationals celebrate faith and friendship in Bundaberg under the PALM scheme
item.description: Moving to another country to provide for your family is not an easy choice but singing, hugs and faith make it easier for these Pacific island workers.

item.title: Beloved Ballarat tai chi teacher granted visa after community push
item.description: Jack Yang's immigration lawyer said his chances of staying in Australia were "nearly zero," but Ballarat's tai chi community had other plans.

item.title: Alice Springs program Bikes Mwerre marks four years of after-school riding, learning
item.description: An Alice Springs teenager who grew up with cycling program Bikes Mwerre is now sharing his knowledge with the next generation. It's a full-circle moment for the outback program built on pride, skills and belonging.

item.title: Ashes 2025: Nathan Lyon injured as Australia wins series on day five of the third Test at the Adelaide Oval
item.description: Ben Stokes laments the end of England's Ashes "dream" as Australia wins the third Test by 82 runs on a surprisingly tense final day to take an unassailable 3-0 series lead.

item.title: Salt lakes' 'unreal' rainbow of colours captured by photographer in WA's Wheatbelt
item.description: For photographer Scott Jon McCook, seeing the unique salt lakes of WA's Wheatbelt from the air was so captivating it started a five-year passion project.

item.title: Nick Kyrgios handed wildcard into Brisbane International as his tennis return continues
item.description: Former Wimbledon finalist Nick Kyrgios is handed a wildcard to the Brisbane International as he sets sights on an Australian Open return.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Paraplegic engineer becomes the first wheelchair user to blast into space
item.description: The flight was just 10 minutes but the capsule still managed to soar 105 kilometres up, skimming into space.

item.title: Destructive storms pass through Melbourne with extreme fire danger in north-west
item.description: Victorians faced intense rainfall, damaging winds and large hailstones after severe storms swept across parts of the state. Emergency services called on road users to drive carefully in dangerous conditions.

item.title: Approaching her 80th birthday, Joan Jeffery is still riding high
item.description: While many people entering their 80s are struggling with physical or mental limitations, Joan Jeffery still manages to do all the heavy lifting of caring for a horse.

item.title: Agnes Water Museum says it houses a 100-year-old orange in its collection
item.description: Visitors question why the piece of citrus was kept in the first place, but the small town museum credits the region's weather conditions which kept it from rotting.

item.title: US strikes kill at least five IS members in Syria, monitor says
item.description: The operation employed more than 100 precision munitions targeting known IS infrastructure and weapons sites, according to a US Centcom statement.

item.title: PM announces review of intelligence and law enforcement in wake of Bondi attack
item.description: Former top bureaucrat Dennis Richardson is appointed to lead the review, which will report in April of next year.

item.title: After the Bondi attack, the contrast between Chris Minns and Anthony Albanese has been stark
item.description: As Sydneysiders paid their respects to the Bondi terror victims, one moment captured the contrast between two Labor leaders and their perceived responses to antisemitism.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: NT government pulls funding for puberty blockers, gender-affirming hormones for children
item.description: Northern Territory Health Minister Steve Edgington announces the withdrawal of public funding for puberty blockers and hormone treatments for children, labelling them "dangerous, ideologically driven practices".

item.title: Australian 15-year-old Indra Brown claims World Cup silver in the freeski halfpipe
item.description: Melbourne 15-year-old Indra Brown claims her second medal in her World Cup debut in the freeski halfpipe.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Nathan Lyon injured on fifth day of Adelaide Test as England hunt a miracle to keep Ashes series alive
item.description: The 38-year-old spinner pulls up lame after diving to save a boundary in the morning session of the fifth day of the third Ashes Test at Adelaide Oval.

item.title: Police investigate alleged daylight assault of woman at Burleigh Heads National Park
item.description: Police are appealing for information after a woman was allegedly assaulted in broad daylight on a popular Gold Coast walking track.

item.title: How a Reddit tip proved vital for uncovering the suspect of the Brown University shooting
item.description: On December 13 a gunman killed two Brown University students and wounded nine others, escaping by foot.

item.title: How staying quiet led Pluribus to be one of the most talked about shows of 2025
item.description: Pluribus, the new show from Breaking Bad and Better Call Saul creator Vince Gilligan, presents a life of perfect harmony — all you have to do is give up your individuality.

item.title: Nathan Lyon's hamstring, Marnus Labuschagne's hands and Jamie Smith's hack — quick hits from day five of third Ashes Test
item.description: Jamie Smith is pilloried as "a dope" after an ugly dismissal as Nathan Lyon is injured and Marnus Labuschagne creates more catching magic. Here are the quick hits from day five of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

item.title: At 6:47pm, Australia paused to remember victims of Bondi Beach shooting
item.description: In a nationwide memorial, Australians have taken a moment to light a candle and quietly remember the 15 people killed at Bondi. Their names, stories and legacies are held close by a shaken, grieving community.

item.title: Australia defeats words with actions to outclass England and romp to Ashes glory
item.description: In the pre-series furore, with England crowing and injury concerns mounting, Australia stayed quiet. Its response has been an emphatic and quite brilliant Ashes domination.

item.title: Jewish community gathers for Bondi Beach shooting vigil and commemoration
item.description: At 6:47pm, one week to the minute after the start of the Bondi Beach terror attack, silence fell across the dusk gathering on the final night of the Jewish festival of light.

item.title: Nine killed, 10 wounded in South African pub shooting
item.description: The incident happened just before 1am local time at a licensed tavern in Johannesburg's Bekkersdal township.

item.title: Is 2025 ending with an AI bubble? We could be at a turning point in history
item.description: What makes the AI-driven stock market bubble unique in history is that if it's not a bubble, the impact on humanity could be far more challenging than any previous technology.

item.title: Here's what defined Australian politics in 2025
item.description: The ABC's political reporters, commentators and broadcasters reflect on what defined the year in politics.

item.title: Staff at Melbourne building company say wages went unpaid as employer threw lavish parties
item.description: Since 2017, Melbourne building boss Mike Harris has overseen four company collapses. Left behind are clients who have lost their life savings and staff who couldn't pay their mortgages.

item.title: What we do and don't know about the Bondi gunmen's month in the Philippines
item.description: The long shadow of the Bondi shooting has darkened the coastal southern Philippines, causing deep confusion and stoking long-held anxieties over terrorist groups in the region.

item.title: Calls for gun law reform clash with gun lobby resistance
item.description: Straight-pull rapid-fire rifles, social media campaigns, and a looming buyback scheme – Australia's gun debate is reloading.

item.title: Doctors delay surgery for patients on GLP-1 drugs like Ozempic over increased risk of pulmonary aspiration
item.description: Doctors say they are forced to delay some procedures due to the risk of serious consequences for patients on Ozempic-like drugs.

item.title: Insolvent business run by former AFL star wipes its debt of millions, and the taxpayer is left to foot the bill
item.description: A digital marketing agency run by a former AFL star has wiped its millions in debt through an insolvency process, only to open under a new ABN days later. Former staff were left without a job and almost $450,000 in unpaid entitlements, but it's within the bounds of the law and leaves taxpayers footing the bill.

item.title: England's Bazballers finally admit they've got things wrong in this Ashes series
item.description: Losing an Ashes Test series in Australia is nothing new for England, but finally the Bazballers are looking inwards at their own failings after a stirring end to the Adelaide Test.

item.title: US says it is intercepting third Venezuelan oil tanker amid simmering tensions
item.description: If successful, it would be the third oil tanker seized as Donald Trump continues his campaign on President Nicolas Maduro.

item.title: Long-awaited wine industry mandatory code of conduct too late for growers
item.description: After 20 years, three senate inquiries and an independent review, the sale of wine grapes will be regulated by a mandatory code of conduct, but growers say it might be too late.

item.title: How domestic violence offenders use the court system to inflict more pain
item.description: Jessica Seage fought for six years for the man who raped her to be convicted. Experts say her experience is a stark example of how perpetrators abuse the system to inflict more pain on their victims.

item.title: Given the all clear from cancer, 6yo Laylah celebrates by ringing the bell at the Queensland Children's Hospital
item.description: When six-year-old Laylah-Jane Morton rang the bell at the Queensland Children's Hospital, it marked the end of her chemotherapy treatment for blood cancer — and she had her merry band of eight siblings with her to help her celebrate.

item.title: Christmas bonuses boost staff morale, but employers facing 'tighter margins' may struggle to give
item.description: From hams to vouchers and cash, festive bonuses vary — but do they still have a place in the Australian workforce?

item.title: In pictures: Thousands honour Bondi victims at emotional beachside memorial
item.description: Emotional scenes and a heavy police presence are visible at Bondi Beach as the Jewish community and other locals mark one week since the Hanukkah shooting.

item.title: Safety fears as Embark Education launches takeover bid for childcare rival, Mayfield
item.description: Embark Education launches a takeover bid for rival early childcare company Mayfield Education, alarming experts who say providers that fail to meet baseline safety standards are being allowed to expand without oversight.

item.title: Federal government announces 2027 gas reservation scheme, ASX rallies — as it happened
item.description: The federal government announced its intention to start a gas reservation scheme from 2027. The ASX made a strong start to the shortened trading week.

item.title: Welcome Christmas rain in the outback while south-east Queensland will be sweltering
item.description: A tropical low will bring heavy rain and storms to much of Queensland this week while a south-east heatwave persists.

item.title: Nathan Lyon and Pat Cummins likely out of Boxing Day Ashes Test with series secured
item.description: Nathan Lyon's injury leaves selectors with another headache, made trickier by Pat Cummins's admission that he will almost certainly miss the Boxing Day Test now that the Ashes are won.

item.title: High school students forced to fight false allegations of AI cheating
item.description: Pulled out of class, held back after school and forced to prove they're not AI cheats, students say NSW high schools are pitting them against faulty AI detectors.

item.title: Heavily armed specialist police to patrol MCG during Boxing Day Test
item.description: Officers from the Critical Incident Response Team armed with long-arm weapons will patrol outside the MCG during the upcoming Boxing Day Test.

item.title: Man charged with murder after woman's death at Northfield
item.description: A 42-year-old man has been charged with murder after a woman was found dead in a home in Adelaide's northern suburbs on Sunday night.

item.title: Migrants from Bhutan turn to archery to maintain mental wellbeing and find community in Australia
item.description: Transitioning from "the happiest nation on earth" to a fast-paced Western society is not without its challenges for Perth's booming Bhutanese population, some of whom have taken up archery to improve their mental health.

item.title: How your town can become a 'dementia-friendly' community
item.description: The small Victorian town of Ouyen, 440 kilometres north-west of Melbourne, is known for its grain and sheep farms, but also for being "dementia friendly".

item.title: Man arrested for knife possession at Christmas carols event in Launceston
item.description: Police charge a man after he allegedly produced a 30-centimetre knife at a Christmas carols event in Launceston.

item.title: Nikhil Chaudhary hits six out of Kardinia Park in match-winning BBL half-century for Hobart Hurricanes
item.description: Hobart star Nikhil Chaudhary launches a ball onto the roof of Kardinia Park in Geelong, but his 79 off 38 is still not enough to earn him player of the match honours in the win over the Renegades.

item.title: Seasonal workers claim unfair bonus cuts and poor conditions on NSW cherry orchard
item.description: Ten pickers who worked at Hallmark Cherries' orchard in NSW complain about poorly maintained accommodation and failure to pay an end-of-season bonus.

item.title: James Ransone, star of The Wire and It: Chapter Two, dies at age 46
item.description: James Ransone, an actor best known for playing Ziggy Sobotka in The Wire and also starring in It: Chapter Two, has died, according to LA medical authorities.

item.title: Calls for urgent intervention to help Victorian teachers find affordable housing
item.description: Victorian teachers say they are exhausted, living almost 100 kilometres from work, as their salaries fail to sustain housing costs.

item.title: Jenny Croom thought Portrait Artist of the Year was a scam — then she won it
item.description: Jenny Croom put her art on hold for her family; now the 77-year-old has been crowned Australia's 2025 Portrait Artist of the Year.

item.title: School children have inspired art works which will be installed on wind turbines in WA's Goldfields.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Seven wind turbines provide unique canvas for Indigenous artist Sara Riches
item.description: A renewable energy project being built at one of Western Australia's biggest gold mines has been transformed into a unique canvas for an Indigenous artist and about 200 schoolchildren.

item.title: NSW parliament likely to pass Australia's toughest gun laws, crackdown on protests
item.description: NSW parliament looks likely to pass what would be the strictest gun laws in Australia.

item.title: Zdravko 'Zed' Bilic's legacy to live on through youth sport initiative
item.description: The wife of the beloved soccer coach, who died during a home invasion, wants to help break the cycle of youth crime through sport.

item.title: Former chief justice urges national Bondi terror attack royal commission
item.description: Calls for the federal government to hold a royal commission into the Bondi terror attack continue after NSW announced intentions for a state-level royal commission, prompting some confusion about the difference.

item.title: Government confirms plans for gas reservation on east coast
item.description: Chris Bowen makes a long-anticipated announcement about reserving a portion of gas on the east coast for domestic use after a cabinet meeting.

item.title: Lake George hides an earthquake fault zone, and scientists are using your road noise to see it
item.description: Almost 100 sensors beside the Federal Highway are helping build the clearest picture yet of the fault beneath the iconic lake.

item.title: Epstein files fallout continues with push for US Attorney-General Pam Bondi to be held in contempt
item.description: Two congressmen say they will recommend United States Attorney-General Pam Bondi be held in contempt of Congress for not releasing all of the Epstein files by the legal deadline.

item.title: How people across Australia and the world have reflected on the Bondi terrorist attack
item.description: Yesterday we asked our readers to tell us how they had honoured the victims of the Bondi terrorist attack, one week on.

item.title: Building a village means showing up even when it feels hard, says Esther Perel
item.description: Building and maintaining a village doesn't just happen. It takes effort. It means showing up even when it feels hard or inconvenient, says psychotherapist Esther Perel.

item.title: Children and staff abducted from Nigerian school released
item.description: No group has claimed responsibility for the November 21 abduction of more than 300 children and staff from a Nigerian Catholic school.

item.title: Bondi Beach shooting victim Dan Elkayam farewelled as floral tributes removed from memorial
item.description: French engineer Dan Elkayam has been remembered as an adventurous young man who loved travelling, meeting new people, playing soccer and celebrating his Jewish faith at his funeral.

item.title: Bondi gunmen filmed 'firearms training' and threw explosives into crowd, court told
item.description: The Bondi gunman accused of killing 15 people conducted "firearms training" in a regional area with his father and recorded a video about their "justification" for the attack, according to documents released by a Sydney court.

item.title: Measles cases almost triple in Australia as global outbreaks continue
item.description: The number of measles cases nationwide is now approaching triple the number of cases reported in 2024 as outbreaks continue around the world.

item.title: Royal commission into Bondi attack appears inevitable for Albanese government
item.description: The prime minister is undoubtedly facing tough conversations behind closed doors, but until the public gets to witness the scrutiny he will never satisfy his critics.

item.title: Tasmanians in 1971 speak about legalising cannabis
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Why Mitchell Starc is open to playing on to the 2027 Ashes series
item.description: Mitchell Starc will be 37 by the time the 2027 Ashes kicks off in 18 months' time, but the in-form quick is open to spearheading Australia's attack in their next clash with England.

item.title: Steve Cubis has been accused of defrauding millions from Aussie investors.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Steve Cubis has been accused of defrauding millions from Aussie investors.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Steve Cubis has been accused of defrauding millions from Aussie investors.

item.title: Steve Cubis has been accused of defrauding millions from Aussie investors.

item.title: Steve Cubis has been accused of defrauding millions from Aussie investors.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Steve Cubis has been accused of defrauding millions from Aussie investors.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Industry and musicians explore ways to make vinyl records more environmentally friendly
item.description: Artists like Stella Donnelly are searching for ways to cut waste and make production of their albums environmentally friendly.

item.title: Pittsburgh Steelers star DK Metcalf lashes out at Detroit Lions fan
item.description: Steelers wide receiver DK Metcalf is expected to face scrutiny after he attempted to strike a fan in the second quarter of Pittsburgh's win over Detroit.

item.title: Anthony Albanese apologises for what Jewish community experienced after Bondi attack
item.description: Anthony Albanese says he is "sorry" for what Jewish Australians have experienced, while announcing a package of legislative changes.

item.title: Victorian government to crack down on hate speech, review gun laws following Bondi terror attack
item.description: In the wake of last week's terrorist attack at Bondi Beach, Premier Jacinta Allan unveils a five-point plan targeting antisemitism in Victoria and providing a "pathway to normal" for the state's Jewish community.

item.title: Stuart Broad still believes Australia's Ashes-winning team is their worst side in 15 years
item.description: Stuart Broad has attracted plenty of criticism for his low opinion of the current Australian team but the England great stands by his harsh assessment.

item.title: Family tells inquest young mother 'died of a broken heart' as system failed to protect her
item.description: The NSW Coroners Court hands down findings into the 2023 death of a young Indigenous mother after a doctor gave evidence the woman may have died from "broken-heart syndrome".

item.title: Prince William and Prince George help make Christmas lunch at homelessness charity in London
item.description: From America, the Duke and Duchess of Sussex have also sent out their Christmas wishes on Instagram.

item.title: Should I pour leftover liquids or foods down the sink?
item.description: Ever been about to pour rancid milk down the sink and thought, "Hmm, maybe I shouldn't…"? What about the tomato passata that's gone off? Or the water you washed the paint in? Or that pungent oil from a tuna can?

item.title: Queensland man arrested following dozens of antisemitic graffiti offences
item.description: A Coolum Beach man is charged with 25 counts of wilful damage following a spate of antisemitic graffiti incidents.

item.title: Racing tribunal bans greyhound trainer Gerry Orr for six years over prohibited substances
item.description: Victorian trainer Gerry Orr has received a six-year ban for procuring performance-enhancing drugs after he inadvertently alerted stewards by giving authorities his mobile phone.

item.title: City Beach fined $14m by Federal Court over button battery safety breaches
item.description: The Federal Court orders the fashion retailer to pay $14 million in fines after it was taken to court by the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission.

item.title: Japan prepares to restart world's biggest nuclear plant, 15 years after Fukushima
item.description: Japan has taken the final step to allow the world's largest nuclear power plant to resume operations with a regional vote in Niigata prefecture.

item.title: Festive season to bring Christmas Day heatwave to Perth and Cocos Island tropical cyclone
item.description: Perth is expected to hit a high of 41 degrees on Christmas Day with the Cocos (Keeling) Islands bracing for a tropical cyclone that could intensify to a category two system.

item.title: Glenelg beachside retail precinct reopens after tumultuous period for businesses
item.description: Traders along one of Adelaide's most popular beachside dining and retail strips have welcomed the reopening of roads to traffic, but say recovery will take time.

item.title: Kyrgios not offered Australian Open wildcard as four other Aussies named
item.description: After a career-best year, Queenslander Priscilla Hon was among four Australian Open wildcards named on Monday, but Nick Kyrgios was not among them.

item.title: Thailand and Cambodia set to resume ceasefire negotiations amid deadly border conflict
item.description: Bangkok says the two countries will return to the negotiating table this week amid claims the initial peace deal was rushed for Donald Trump.

item.title: Uber and Lyft partner with Chinese tech giant for self-driving cars in London
item.description: Rideshare companies Uber and Lyft are planning to bring self-driving cars to the streets of London in the first half of 2026.

item.title: Suspect in deadly Taiwan metro attack planned it for over a year, police say
item.description: Police in Taiwan say Chang Wen purchased grenades, gas canisters and respirators in the year leading up to Friday's attack.

item.title: Fire Rescue Victoria sues United Firefighters Union over $1.6m in taxpayer-funded 'service fees'
item.description: Taxpayers have funded $1.6 million in payments to the firefighters union via Fire Rescue Victoria, court documents allege, under an income protection scheme the state's fire chief has said should outrage all Victorians.

item.title: Today in History, December 23: Uruguay legalises recreational cannabis use
item.description: Twelve years ago today, Uruguay became the first country to legalise recreational marijuana use. The experiment is still unfolding.

item.title: Unhinged Christmas movies quiz: Can you pick the real movies from these ridiculous plots?
item.description: Once December rolls around, there's nothing the minor movie studios love more than getting their most unhinged Christmas tropes out of cold storage.

item.title: Cubis claimed he was a composer for Sony Music.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Steven Cubis was the face of GIM Trading when investors lost millions but his story began long before then
item.description: Steven Cubis hides behind a charming facade, but his former lover and friends say the career con man ruined them financially and emotionally long before he was caught up in allegations of a multi-million-dollar fraud.

item.title: Better late than never: The gas fix to a problem that should never have been
item.description: The gas export industry has cost the nation dearly. East coast prices trebled soon after exports began.

item.title: Videos and CCTV give fresh insight into gunmen's plot to target Bondi Beach
item.description: Security camera footage captured the Bondi Beach gunmen carrying what appears to be firearms out of a south-west Sydney property on the morning of the terror attack, court documents reveal.

item.title: Under-16s social media ban sees rise in alternatives in app store
item.description: The Commonwealth's long-awaited social media ban for under-16s came into effect this month. But some experts note a rise in alternatives to popular platforms as teens find ways to stay active on social media.

item.title: Beekepers on high alert as bee-killing varroa mite spreads in South Australia
item.description: The varroa mite may be tiny — only a millimetre or two long — but it poses a huge threat to honey bees, beekeepers and honey producers, who are on high alert after the destructive mite's recent arrival in South Australia.

item.title: The Christmas display at West Hindmarsh delighting children, adults and nuns
item.description: Families from all over Adelaide visit Joe Ferraro's home to marvel at his Christmas display, which he has amassed a collection of more than 50,000 lights since he began nearly 20 years ago.

item.title: World's largest warship looms near Venezuela as US warns of land attacks
item.description: The Pentagon moved the USS Gerald R Ford, the world's largest aircraft carrier, to the Caribbean last month. Now President Donald Trump is repeating threats of imminent strikes against Venezuelan territory.

item.title: A chaotic 'up-crash' as markets and economic realities made for a turbulent 2025
item.description: AI. Market records. Tariffs. Penguins. TACO. It's been a big year of economic shocks and surges as the international framework of global trade was shredded. Here's how key players saw the year that was.

item.title: Liberal-linked Tasmanian public relations firm Font PR shuts
item.description: It has helped keep the Liberals in power in Tasmania and lobbied on behalf of Airbnb, the salmon industry and the Catholic Church — but the PR firm, described as having "fingers in a lot of pies", is closing down.

item.title: Sisters in Sweat — the Sunday football session that grew a sporting movement of over 15,000 Indian women
item.description: Eight years ago, Swetha Subbiah was asked to run a single football session for a friend. She ended up starting a sporting movement, which now has 15,000 women and girls as members across Bengaluru, Mumbai, Hyderabad and Delhi.

item.title: Driving Home for Christmas singer Chris Rea dies aged 74
item.description: The man best known for his festive hit Driving Home for Christmas died surrounded by his family.

item.title: Thousands of birds are dying on a remote island with no end in sight
item.description: The Isle of May is the epicentre of a deadly outbreak of the H5N1 bird flu strain which has spread throughout the globe. Scientists are warning Australia could be next.

item.title: Domestic violence survivor calls for national register to stop perpetrators 'exploiting' loopholes
item.description: Advocates are pushing for a national framework for addressing domestic violence after an ABC investigation highlighted gaps in the justice system and a lack of information sharing between states.

item.title: Russian general Fanil Sarvarov killed by car bomb in Moscow, officials say
item.description: The Kremlin is probing who is behind the killing, which has similarities to previous attacks by Ukrainian special services.

item.title: Two men die in separate stabbing incidents in Melbourne on Monday
item.description: A man died after he was stabbed during an altercation in Clyde, in Melbourne's south-east. Just hours later another man was fatally stabbed in Fitzroy.

item.title: Swiss court to hear Pari islanders' climate change case against cement giant Holcim
item.description: Residents of the tiny Indonesian island of Pari, which risks being swallowed by rising seas, win the right to have their have their climate change case against cement giant Holcim heard in a Swiss court.

item.title: Wild Christmas week ahead for Queensland with days of severe storms forecast as temperatures ease
item.description: The weather bureau is forecasting heavy rainfall and thunderstorms for large parts of the state over the Christmas week, but temperatures are expected to ease.

item.title: New early detection cameras in NSW spotting fires before they spread
item.description: New cameras using AI have been installed in southern New South Wales forests and are spotting fires before they have a chance to spread.

item.title: The Epstein files divided Trump's base and now more fights are brewing
item.description: The release of the Epstein files followed a rare revolt against Donald Trump by some of his dedicated supporters. Here are six more issues that could also divide Republicans.

item.title: Live markets updates: ASX to open slightly up as Wall Street prepares for another month of strong gains
item.description: The Australian share market looks set to open slightly up as the US finishes its trading day with strong gains led by tech stocks. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: What are you really paying when using a card this Christmas?
item.description: Cashless payments make up about three-quarters of all transactions in Australia but come at a cost to both merchants and consumers, leaving some asking if it is time to consider it essential infrastructure.
